channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Extremely rough road surface, 13th March
item.description:
The road surface is delaminating, its extremely rough in places.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 61 Beaumont Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: An awkward pothole, 13th March
item.description:
Entrance to Rye Avenue the are two deep, small but awkward potholes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Rye Avenue, Cheltenham

item.title: Flytipping along Cotswold Way Footpath, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the footpath going past the POld Quarry from the cleeve Common Road. The footpath is part of the Cotswold Way and along quite a bit of its length it has a significant quantity of flytipping ranging from rubbish to tyres. Please can it be cleared up as an increasing number of walkers are using it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish along Public Footpath / Cotswold Way, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the footpath going past the POld Quarry from the cleeve Common Road. item.title: Waste Plastic string / Shredded Material, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the Entrance to the Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road. There is rubbish in front of the entrance wall but more importantly behind the wall which has been used as a burn area there is a quantity of plastic string / shredded material. Please can it be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Frequent flooding drainage problem, 13th March
item.description:
Every time it rains the road floods here. It has been a problem for a while and is getting worse. It floods with even a little rain. It happens by the drains on both sides of the road. Cars are forced out into the middle of the road ahead of a blind bend, in an attempt to cross at the highest point. Some days the flooding is so bad it is not passable, especially on motor bikes, cycles or on foot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Turnpike House Greenway Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
